text: <@U1RLLLQCU>  - you want to use v0.6.1-release-preview now and yes events are implemented in both the fabric and the sdk

<@U0PB67X4K> We still on 0.6.0-preview version of the hyperledger/fabric and using 0.6.1 version of HFC

When we try to register for chaincode or block events through registerChaincodeEvent, registerBlockEvent through the Chain.EventHub as per the chain-tests.js, the callback function doesnt gets invoked, however new  blocks are being added and chaincode invoke are successfull on chaincode, checked. 

Also, see an error after chain.eventHubConnect, E1025 09:27:14.732553520    4436 resolve_address_posix.c:126] getaddrinfo: Name or service not known
<@U1RLLLQCU> this error usually happens when your target endpoint (host ports) are not properly configured, note that event stream is typically on port 7053

<@U13TWBRBL> How do i find out if the host ports are properly configured or not? I started membersrvc and peer. Do i need to do some extra configuration for the event stream so that it can be connected from HFC node.js SDK?

<@U13TWBRBL> <@U0PB67X4K> I upgraded to HFC 0.6.2, but the hyperledger/fabric is still on 0.6.0-preview version. 
Now I dont receive the Name or service not known error which is received with HFC 0.6.1

But still the callback functions of registerChaincodeEvent, registerBlockEvent through the Chain.EventHub are never invoked.

<@U13TWBRBL> <@U0PB67X4K> When i upgraded to HFC 0.6.4, i am starting to receive the block events through registerBlockEvent. 
However, I still don't receive the chaincode events through registerChaincodeEvent. 
What should be the eventname supplied to the registerChaincodeEvent function? In the examples event-tests.js it is mentioned as "^evtsender$". Is it a catch-all name for chaincode events?

Please note i am still using hyperledger/fabric on v0.6.0-preview
